datasetApaReference: Fancourt D, Garnett C, Spiro N, West R, Müllensiefen D (2019) How do artistic creative activities regulate our emotions? Validation of the Emotion Regulation Strategies for Artistic Creative Activities Scale (ERS-ACA). PLOS ONE 14(2): e0211362. https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pone.0211362

instruments.instrumentName: Emotion Regulation Strategies for Artistic Creative Activities scale (ERS-ACA), development version
instruments.instrumentApaReference: Fancourt D, Garnett C, Spiro N, West R, Müllensiefen D (2019) How do artistic creative activities regulate our emotions? Validation of the Emotion Regulation Strategies for Artistic Creative Activities Scale (ERS-ACA). PLOS ONE 14(2): e0211362. https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pone.0211362

scales.scaleName: Emotion Regulation through Artistic Creative Activities

items.itemStemText: When engaging in [name the artistic creative activity], I feel at peace with myself.
When engaging in [name the artistic creative activity], it creates a safe space for me.
When engaging in [name the artistic creative activity], it makes me feel more stressed.
When engaging in [name the artistic creative activity], it evokes strong positive emotions.
When engaging in [name the artistic creative activity], I am completely ‘in the zone’ and only focus on the activity itself.
When engaging in [name the artistic creative activity], it helps me to come to terms with my own emotions.
When engaging in [name the artistic creative activity], I am proud to be doing the activity.
When engaging in [name the artistic creative activity], it redirects my attention so I forget unwanted thoughts and feelings.
When engaging in [name the artistic creative activity], I am reassured of my own abilities.
When engaging in [name the artistic creative activity], it helps me to think rationally about things in my life.
When engaging in [name the artistic creative activity], I can block out any unwanted thoughts or feelings.
When engaging in [name the artistic creative activity], it reaffirms my identity.
When engaging in [name the artistic creative activity], I can contemplate what is going on in my life with a clear mind.
When engaging in [name the artistic creative activity], it reminds me of people and places.
When engaging in [name the artistic creative activity], I can shake off any anxieties in my life.
When engaging in [name the artistic creative activity], it makes me feel stronger in myself.
When engaging in [name the artistic creative activity], I feel less confident in myself and my abilities.
When engaging in [name the artistic creative activity], I conjure up pleasant visual images or daydreams in my mind.
When engaging in [name the artistic creative activity], I feel a part of something bigger.
When engaging in [name the artistic creative activity], it helps me to vent negative feelings such as anger.
When engaging in [name the artistic creative activity], I feel a sense of connection to other people (even people I don’t know) who do.
When engaging in [name the artistic creative activity], it makes me feel detached from negative things in my life.
When engaging in [name the artistic creative activity], it helps me to disengage from things that are bothering me.
When engaging in [name the artistic creative activity], I feel I am in my own little bubble, away from ordinary worries.
When engaging in [name the artistic creative activity], I feel more alone.
When engaging in [name the artistic creative activity], I feel relaxed.
When engaging in [name the artistic creative activity], I feel like I’m part of a community.
When engaging in [name the artistic creative activity], it helps me to put worries or problems I have in perspective.
When engaging in [name the artistic creative activity], I feel more capable of tackling challenges.
When engaging in [name the artistic creative activity], it makes me feel exhilarated and excited.
When engaging in [name the artistic creative activity], I feel more confident in myself.
When engaging in [name the artistic creative activity], my mind feels more agitated.
When engaging in [name the artistic creative activity], I worry more about things in my life.
When engaging in [name the artistic creative activity], it helps me to understand my own feelings on things that are on my mind.
When engaging in [name the artistic creative activity], I imagine myself in another place.
When engaging in [name the artistic creative activity], I think with fondness on past events.
When engaging in [name the artistic creative activity], it boosts my self-esteem.
When engaging in [name the artistic creative activity], I am in my own world.
When engaging in [name the artistic creative activity], it evokes strong happy memories.
When engaging in [name the artistic creative activity], it gives me a sense of purpose.
When engaging in [name the artistic creative activity], it gives me the space to focus on myself.
When engaging in [name the artistic creative activity], I feel like I have a role within society.
When engaging in [name the artistic creative activity], it helps me forget about my worries.
When engaging in [name the artistic creative activity], it helps me refocus on what matters in my life.
When engaging in [name the artistic creative activity], I actively plan about how I can solve worries or problems in my life.
When engaging in [name the artistic creative activity], it helps me to channel feelings of sadness and misery.
When engaging in [name the artistic creative activity], it makes me feel cleansed of negative feelings.
When engaging in [name the artistic creative activity], it makes me reflect on my emotions.
When engaging in [name the artistic creative activity], it produces such strong emotions I get goose bumps.
